headline: Russia ramps up all kinds of recruitment efforts to support its war effort
subhead: Since summer 2025, Russian authorities have struggled to find the thousands of soldiers needed to replenish units suffering ever heavier losses. They have kept the threat of a general mobilization hanging over the country, and volunteers have been replaced by men sent to the front lines after near-forced enlistment.

headline: Mexico deploys 10,000 troops to restore order after violence linked to the death of drug lord 'El Mencho'
More than 200 inmates launch hunger strike to seek benefits under Venezuela's new amnesty law
UK police release ex-envoy Peter Mandelson on bail in Epstein case
subhead: Mandelson, a pivotal figure in British politics and the UK's former envoy to Washington, was arrested on suspicion of misconduct in public office on Monday. His arrest came just days after the former prince Andrew was detained.

headline: China's retired rural workers are finding rest impossible
subhead: In rural China, meager pensions are forcing many retired farmers into urban exile, where survival depends on taking the most precarious jobs.

headline: The secrets of neighing are finally revealed
subhead: To produce this unique sound, the horse performs a 'biphonation': It cries out and whistles at the same time.

headline: Will French investigators soon use American DNA databases to solve cold cases?
subhead: In the SURE bill submitted on February 19, the justice minister plans to introduce an article that would, in particular, allow 'the use of genetic genealogy' in certain cases. These DNA samples come from 'recreational' tests offered by companies over the internet.

Snowstorm in northeastern US leaves 40 million people under weather warnings

Lyon drug traffickers hire Colombian hitmen to kill their rivals
The 'impossible' task of counting deaths at sea
subhead: The International Organization for Migration and migrant aid NGOs simultaneously record deaths at sea in the Mediterranean and Atlantic, but often come up with very different figures. Why?

headline: Dark Bank: American suspected of leading an international criminal organization extradited to France
subhead: Huzefa Hafiz Ismail arrived on French soil on Friday. He was arrested in August 2024 in Texas at the request of French judicial authorities, who suspect him of leading a vast money laundering network.

headline: 2026 Winter Olympics: New infrastructure raises financial and environmental questions
subhead: The anticipated increase in visitor numbers to the protected Alpine regions is the first major impact expected from the Games. Critics have condemned what they call the 'gentrification of the mountains.'

headline: Vladimir Putin, trapped by his own logic of war
'Lawless zones around Israel are the result of the Pax Judaica made possible by uncontested military hegemony'
A stinging rebuke for Donald Trump on tariffs
